docs.title: LoginAs
docs.text: Login as manager user into each frontend account without a password. This MODX Extra adds menu entry in the user menu that allows you to select a MODX user and log in as that user in the frontend without a password. If you are logged as manager user, you can also use the password loginas to log into a web user account in the frontend.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Menu entry in the user menu of the manager that allows you to select a MODX user and log in as that user in the frontend without a password
  • Log in as user in the frontend with the password loginas
  • The menu entry and the global password is available for MODX manager users that have the loginas_loginas permission assigned.

docs.title: Install from MODX Extras
docs.text: Search for LoginAs in the Package Manager of a MODX installation and install it in there.

docs.title: Manual installation
docs.text:
If you can't access the MODX Extras Repository in your MODX installation, you can manually install LoginAs.

  • Download the transport package from MODX Extras (or one of the pre built transport packages in _packages)
  • Upload the zip file to your MODX installation's core/packages folder or upload it manually in the MODX Package Manager.
  • In the MODX Manager, navigate to the Package Manager page, and select 'Search locally for packages' from the dropdown button.
  • LoginAs should now show up in the list of available packages. Click the corresponding 'Install' button and follow the instructions to complete the installation.

docs.title: Build it from source
docs.text: To build and install the package from source you could use Git Package Management. The GitHub repository of LoginAs contains a config.json to build that package locally. Use this option, if you want to debug LoginAs and/or contribute bugfixes and enhancements.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text:
This MODX Extra adds menu entry in the user menu that allows you to select a MODX user and log in as that user in the frontend without a password. If you are logged as manager user, you can also use the password loginas to log into a web user account in the frontend.

LoginAs uses the following system settings in the namespace loginas:

Key Name Description Default loginas.add_contexts Additional Contexts Comma separated list of additional contexts for frontend authentication. - loginas.debug Debug Log debug information in the MODX error log. No loginas.login_context Login Context Main context for frontend authentication. web loginas.login_id Login ID ID of a MODX Resource with a Login snippet call. -
